content: The session was full when I joined - what was the verdict, is REST dead?
no. It's not dead. But it's surprising that parts of the community are not more interested in graphql
REST is dead. Webhooks are back baby
Its far from dead. @Grahame Grieve I guess it is just hard to convince customers that they now need to pay for this extra functionality now that they have 'just' payed to get on FHIR
sure they can spend more money by not using graphql.
Touch√© - that might be a slight oversimplification
also ... it is not in all setups where the vendor is both the supplier of the backend AND the frontend
